adjective.description: (of a person's face or complexion) of an unhealthy yellow or pale brown color.
examples: his skin was sallow and pitted

noun.description: A willow tree, especially one of a low-growing or shrubby kind.
A moth with dull yellow, orange, and brown patterned wings. The larvae of some species feed on sallow catkins.

origin: Old English salh, of Germanic origin; related to Old Norse selja, and Latin salix willow.
